title: Benchmark Data
description: Schema for GPU benchmark data files. Each file represents benchmark results for a specific configuration (e.g., Counter-Strike 2 at 4K resolution).

metricSlug.description: PRIMARY IDENTIFIER. URL-friendly slug used as the unique key for this metric throughout the web app. Used in URLs (e.g., /gpu/ranking/gaming/counter-strike-2-fps-3840x2160), database MetricDefinition.slug, and GpuMetricValue.metricSlug. Format: {game-name}-fps-{resolution} for gaming benchmarks.

benchmarkId.description: GROUPING IDENTIFIER. Short identifier for the benchmark program/game. Multiple configurations share the same benchmarkId. Used to group related benchmarks in the UI (e.g., all Counter-Strike 2 resolutions together).

benchmarkName.description: Human-readable name of the benchmark program/game. Displayed in UI headings and metric selector.

configuration.description: Human-readable description of the specific configuration (resolution, settings, etc.). Displayed in UI to distinguish between configurations of the same benchmark.

configurationId.description: SOURCE PROVENANCE. The original identifier from the benchmark source (e.g., OpenBenchmarking's internal configuration ID). Used for tracking data lineage and debugging. Not used by the web app directly.

metricName.description: Name of the metric being measured.

unit.description: Full unit name for the metric value.

description.description: Detailed description of the benchmark for learn/info pages.

descriptionDollarsPer.description: Description for cost-per-performance pages explaining what $/unit means.

category.description: Category for organizing metrics. 'gaming' for game benchmarks, 'ai' for compute/ML specs.

collectedSamples.description: Number of benchmark samples collected from the source. Higher counts indicate more reliable data.

updatedAt.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of when this data was last scraped/updated.

gpuNameRaw.description: GPU name as reported by the benchmark source. May not match our canonical GPU names.

gpuNameMapped.description: Our canonical GPU name (from gpu-name-mapping.yaml). Only present if mapping exists.
